thread.title: Barnes & Noble will close Towson store in May
thread.title_full: Barnes & Noble will close Towson store in May

author: Lorraine Mirabella
title: Barnes & Noble will close Towson store in May
text:
(Rachael Pacella) 
Plans call for mid-rise apartments built on the current sunken parking lot that serves Barnes & Noble and Trader Joe's, with street level stores and and high rise apartments above a parking garage and former Bahama Breeze restaurant, which closed in June. 
Tim O'Connell, a spokesman for Retail Properties, said Monday the company had no information or comment on Barnes & Nobles' plans. 
"Our goal is to obviously add as many attractive tenants as we possibly can to this new development," he said. 
The project is in the design approval phase, and no retail tenants have been announced yet, he said. Caption Growth in solar industry provides more jobs 
Matt McDonough, a solar panel installer, talks about the industry's growth and how that has provided more jobs. (Kenneth K. Lam/Baltimore Sun video) 
Matt McDonough, a solar panel installer, talks about the industry's growth and how that has provided more jobs. (Kenneth K. Lam/Baltimore Sun video) Caption Mission BBQ is looking to grow 
Bill Kraus, co-founder of Mission BBQ, talks about the company's history and how they are looking to grow. (Kenneth K. Lam/Baltimore Sun video) 
Bill Kraus, co-founder of Mission BBQ, talks about the company's history and how they are looking to grow. (Kenneth K. Lam/Baltimore Sun video)
